org.lwjgl.glfw

Class GLFWDropCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.system.Retainable.Default
      • org.lwjgl.system.libffi.Closure
        • org.lwjgl.system.libffi.Closure.Void
          • org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWDropCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer, Retainable

    public abstract class GLFWDropCallback
extends Closure.Void
    Instances of this interface may be passed to the GLFW.glfwSetDropCallback(long, org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWDropCallback) method.

      • GLFWDropCallback

    • Method Detail

      • callback

        protected void callback(long args)
        Will be called from a libffi closure invocation. Decodes the arguments and passes them to GLFWDropCallback.invoke(long, int, long).
        Specified by:
        callback in class Closure.Void
        Parameters:
        args - pointer to an array of jvalues

      • invoke

        public abstract void invoke(long window,
          int count,
          long names)
        Will be called when one or more dragged files are dropped on the window.
        Parameters:
        window - the window that received the event
        count - the number of dropped files
        names - pointer to the array of UTF-8 encoded path names of the dropped files
